intro: Epilobium canadense var. albescens, commonly known as white willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the genus Epilobium in the family Onagraceae, which includes species with showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist environments, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. The white petals and stamen are prominent, making it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
